instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01987 5V USB C, no liquid damage
threads.message:
this one has 5V on amp meter, i already replaced the two CD chips, no difference 
PPBUS is 12.3v
PP3v3_g3h_rtc is 0.8V though

threads.title: 820-01987 5V USB C, no liquid damage
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground at 3V3_G3H_RTC?
Compare with good board.

threads.title: 820-01987 5V USB C, no liquid damage
threads.message: Got 0.359 on the faulty board and 0.45 on a CPU dead board same model

threads.title: 820-01987 5V USB C, no liquid damage
threads.message:
Check R6910-13 and their traces.
Post U6903 voltages.

threads.title: 820-01987 5V USB C, no liquid damage
threads.message: FIXED! U6903 change solved it. you legendary legend you!
